org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class NameCache<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.NameCache<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - name to be added to the cache

     class NameCache<K>
extends Object
    Caches frequently used names to facilitate reuse. (example: byte[] representation of the file name in INode). This class is used by initially adding all the file names. Cache tracks the number of times a name is used in a transient map. It promotes a name used more than useThreshold to the cache. One all the names are added, initialized() should be called to finish initialization. The transient map where use count is tracked is discarded and cache is ready for use.

    This class must be synchronized externally.

        Size of the cache
        Returns:
        Number of names stored in the cache

      • initialized

        void initialized()
        Mark the name cache as initialized. The use count is no longer tracked and the transient map used for initializing the cache is discarded to save heap space.
